description:
The food here is fast, amazing and fresh.  

The flavors are off-the-chart. 

The green creamy hot sauce is incredible but only use a tiny bit and get it on the side.  It adds a remarkable new dimension to the already full flavors.

I wish they had this restaurant in Southern California.
author: Wong Fook H.

description:
Unique and a fresh take on Indian food. Kasa specializes in Indian street food. They have a few core dishes as well as some rotating specialities. The food is consistently fresh, healthy, and well seasoned. The service is always good to great. If your not too hungry get the rolls. If your more hungry get the Indian burrito or the plate.  

Kasa has a few locations as well as food carts that operate around the Bay Area.
author: Alan H.

description:
So happy to be sitting here now on their tenth anniversary!  Honestly, I had eaten here several years ago and didn't think much of what I had.  Today, I had a lamb wrap - the lamb is so tender and the sauces are amazing.  Also, as it's their tenth anniversary, they gave free chai tea, and it's one of the best that I've had.  

Will come back more often for the lamb.
author: Ernest S.

description: Whenever I come to SF I crave good Indian food and I always try to dine somewhere new. My friend Rita always chooses the best and finest. I love this place. It's not a big place but it's clean, it's fast service, price is reasonable and the food is really delicious. The food is very healthy and they are eco friendly. They have two other locations. We went to the location in the Castro district.
author: DJ Nocturna R.

description:
Sad, I wasn't happy tonight at all. I got the combo plate, it looked real good ..... but was bad, the Chicken Tikka Masala was way too salty, chicken was dry, chewy & not creamy sauce. The lentils were boring, the Saag Paneer was bleh. When I complained they just said, "oh, sorry"
It will be a while before I even want Indian Cuisine again.
author: Mcrag M.

description: I could smell the food few blocks away, did a Yelp search and found this Indian lunch buffet! Great selection with lots of veggie options. A bit too mild for me, but a great lunch buffet!
author: courtney m.

description: Never miss kasa if u are in SFO area. Just try their kati roll and tea.  Wish they make paneer Tikka roll(dry) like chicken Tikka.
author: Victoria Y.

description:
Went to Kasa for the first time today, after having their catering at various neighborhood events (and meeting the kwnees).  My only complaint is that I didn't come here sooner!! 

The style and vibe of this delicious Indian eatery make me glad to live in San Francisxo.  Incredibly satisfied with the chicken tikka masala, the serving size, the just-right spice and flavor.  For what I got, it was under priced.

No photo of the food because I ate it so quickly!
author: Luke B.

description:
Kati rolls are made in good hefty portions so be careful of over-ordering. Their entree is big enough for two. We definitely didn't expect that and ended up wasting a lot of food. No room to try their samosas and no room for any desserts after dinner.

Hot sauce means hot! Thou art warned.
author: Yad L.

description:
AMAZING!!! This place has incredible vegan options, and even a fountain soda machine with sodas sweetened with agave and other unique flavors (like pineapple cream soda, delicious!!!). 

Now mind you, I don't live in SF. My friend who was visiting me from LA and I decided to take a trip into SF. As we were walking towards the Castro district, starving and ready to chow down, low and behold.. this incredible place caught our eyes. And i'm so glad it did! I got the combo plate with the channa masala and the potatoes and cauliflower. The channa masala was honestly the BEST channa masala I have ever tried... truly, truly delicious. We also tried all the fountain sodas, and we never drink soda... so to say that we loved it, is an understatement! My friend got the combo platter as well, with the chicken and lamb. She enjoyed the chicken, but not the lamb. 

I'm so excited to come back, I just wish they had this place in Berkeley where I live!
author: Maggie T.

description: VERY pleased with the food and service at Kasa. I had seen Kasa on many websites and reviews so I decided to check it out. It was reasonably cheap for SF and it was a big portion of food . Reminds me of Mexican food with a different taste.
author: Jon P.

description:
I had the lunch special of one Kati roll, saag paneer, which comes with a drink, which I upgraded to a mango lassi and you get a bowl of daal and a some yougurt

The man making our meal and also running the register  was very patient and even took our group picture for us 

Everything was very tasty.  

Everyone in my group of six loved their lunch.  I especially heard raves about the chai tea 

Our group hiked four miles this morning to Kite  Hill and Corona Heights Park, amazing views On a super  clear day 

Easy walk to Castro muni
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Gosh I hate writing this review! I never write these things, especially when they're negative. But I just am hoping....
I really like(d) this place, so I'm hoping management will read this and do something about it. I love Kasa. The flavors are awesome and the food is unique. *However* Lately they've been slipping. My boyfriend and I usually ordered two Kati rolls a piece and an order of samosas. (It's really a shame when they run out of the samosas!) Today I ordered my rolls and something(s) went horribly wrong. When I saw the person serving me dousing the roti in oil and then slapping it on the grill I should have just stopped. When they started the 4 rolls I asked for a little cilantro and they were quite heavy handed. No big deal. I can live. But then I ordered two chicken tikka masala rolls and it got worse. My server gave me plain chicken tikka. When I pointed out the mistake they just took some sauce from the chicken tikka masala and poured it over the dry chicken tikka. That's not chicken tikka masala. That's chicken tikka, with masala sauce. The rolls were so over stuffed they weren't able to actually be wrapped. It was sort of like an taco? All of the masala sauce ended up stuck to the foil. The kicker was when I went to retrieve my vegetarian taco/rolls from the white cardboard container they had been sitting in. There was so much oil on the roti that it had actually leaked out and pooled at the bottom of the box. It was disgusting. I just couldn't bring myself to eat it. This isn't the first time in the recent past that the staff's attitude has actually ruined my experience. I really love this place and would love if the staff cared about their jobs. Without care, the food can't taste as good as it should, and I'm getting tired of throwing my money into the garbage.
author: PieTheSwingCat T.

description: Kasa is one of the only affordable restaurants in the Castro with really nice people working there, who care about their food and their customers. The food is not mind blowing, but it's consistently tasty and on the healthy side and their chai is exceptional.
author: SF R.

description:
PSA: DO NOT EAT HERE UNLESS YOU WANT FOOD POISONING. 

day 2 and I'm currently in dire pain aka I have the MF runs and it sucks. This was the last meal I had before I started feeling funny. I don't know what it is- the improper storage of the food or if the food was sitting out all day long. Nonetheless, I am feeling sick ever since eating here. 

I came here to get some food to go. I order a Kati roll with chicken tika masala. I munched in half of it for dinner and was planning on eating it the next day for lunch. Nope. When I woke up this morning, the sound of my tummy was like a crying baby chihuahua. I tore the toilet up (sorry TMI). I could not eat and nothing sounded appetizing. I literally stuffed my face with sparkling water and tums. Up to today, I'm having major issue with my digestion tract. I may even go to the doctor to see if I have any bacteria in my gut. I'm sick just writing this review. 

Long story short. Do not eat here..
author: Marie N.

description:
I was driving for Lyft today never knowing where people will take me. It's a lovely adventure. Then feeling the hunger pains and knowing I must stop I looked over and to my right was a lovely purple building, on it Indian Cuisine. Hum I thought should I dare. Then looking up as the corner traffic light turned green, to my surprise was free parking available. This must be destiny. Still timid to try something different I wandered in and looked at the menu. I didn't see anything I recognized, like the usual falafel, or sharama, but I asked and decided to jump into a new flavor. 
And Yes Yes Yes I'm so happy. This place is great. You must go !! I put it on my favorites and will differently return. Nice friendly staff and healthy eats !!
author: Johnna R.

description:
This is a fast casual eatery, sorta like Chipotle in that you just point what you want.

The Thali plate is $13.50 and is quite a lot of food. Price is a bit hefty but what do you expect in the Castro? 

I liked the Chicken Tikka Masala, which was seasoned heavily and actually spicier than what I thought it would be. The daal (lentils) were OK and the palak paneer (spinach with cheese) was solid.

However, I didn't enjoy the basmati rice in the thali, which was crispy and hard, but not in a good way. The food also got cold quite quickly, especially since the restaurant was cold and the food is served on stainless steel. 20 minutes later after being plated, the food was a few degrees colder than room temperature. 

It's a clean and solid place, so I'd come back if I was in the area.
author: Gabriel H.

description: This was... Disappointing. I love most Indian food but this was at best 'meh'. The rice was overcooked to the point of being mushy, as was the nearly flavorless Gobi Aloo. The lamb curry wasn't bad but mostly because it tasted like lamb. And the chicken Tika basically tasted like tomato sauce with some red pepper flakes. To add insult to injury, $2 worth of roti is a single 6" round.
author: Jade S.

description:
We had Kasa deliver a large order for a party of 100 guests. Delivery was right on time and quality and overall taste of everything was excellent. One problem though, there was a mix-up in the order and we were given about 25 rolls of a wrong item. We called and they quickly made the right order, delivered it quickly, and charged us nothing for it. So even though something went wrong, Kasa fixed it immediately. 

We'll order from them again and totally recommend them!
author: Ashton M.

description:
This review is for takeout.
The concept is definitely an interesting one. Indian food in a burrito? We actually saw the Kasa on Pine and Polk while out at lunch and next thing I knew, R suggested that we should get some Kasa for dinner. The Kasa on Castro was much closer to where he lived. The restaurant itself is also small but located in the corner of a very cute neighborhood. 
He got the roll that comes wrapped in naan bread with chicken tikka. He really liked it. He had also ordered it with spicy sauce but for some reason, the sauce ended up being all the way at the end of the roll so he didn't really taste any spiciness until he was almost finished with it. 
I got the platter w/ the cauliflowers and tikka masala. It came with this strange salad w/ a yogurt dressing. Not my favorite part of the platter, I admit. However, everything else tasted pretty good. The goo alobi was soft and tender. Sadly, I can't say the same for the chicken tikka masala. The chicken pieces was a bit tough for me. 
We had also gotten drinks. I loved their chai and when it's cooled a bit, so refreshing. The mango lassi was not like the other kinds we had drank before. There were pieces of spices mixed in it, like cardamon, and ended up having a spicy aftertaste. 
Anyways, I can see us getting takeout from Kasa when we can't decide between Mexican and Indian food.
author: Michelle R.

description: This place most definitely gets 5 stars. I got the lamb thali and it was amazing. As someone who was born and raised into an Indian family I have a standard of what Indian foods I consume. Everything tasted fresh and amazingly/perfectly spiced. The employees were really nice when I got there and picked up my food. Its a really clean place and well kept/maintained.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
Another fast casual spot modeled after the Chipotle system. I shared the thali with a friend and we got the lamb curry and saag paneer. The colors on the platter were beautiful as it was served with a small salad, yogurt sauce, daal and a few sauces. The lamb curry was probably my favorite, a good amount of meat and flavors came through well. The rice on this platter was a little undercooked and super cold which was MEH. 

We also tried the samosa which was yummy and served with mint sauce, not as fragrant as other samosas I've had but crispy on the outside. Overall I would rather try something else in the area, or go to a more authentic place -- but this may be a great gateway into Indian food if you aren't used to the flavors!
author: Hana S.

description: Came in with a friend for lunch on a Wednesday. Kasa had recently opened, and I think we were their first guests of the day. I ordered the Chicken Tikka Salad -- delicious. The chicken was perfectly seasoned, and the vegetables were fresh  and crunchy. For the price of your usual salad in SF, lunch was that much more enjoyable because of the catchy Indian music playing in the background, and their eclectic theme/artwork.
author: Dan P.

description:
Their Thali is great! I've had it a few times and its very consistent. And dont be fooled, you can get it to go as well! They pack it in a nice tray and somehoe fit in all the 17+ items! Ok well tbh the thali has like 8 things. I usually get the paneer and Chicken curry. Paneer can use some improvement, but the chicken, dal, rice, salad is really good. Feels quite fresh.

The roti that comes with the thali is ok, (just pita bread)
Also I've tried the kathi rolls at this place and its not so good. Try to skip it (or try another restaurant for kathi rolls)

The restaurant itself is very clean, and nice location in the mission (corner location, big window=very open)

I'm giving it 5 stars for the awesome Thali. It also fulfills like 2 meals so the $12 is well spent
author: Arjan N.

description:
Westernized Indian food with that Chipotle line feel. Order at the counter, get your own utensils, wait for the food to come in 2.79 minutes flat. I like the efficiency, clean environment, and available seating. 

Food is affordable and tastes good too! We've had the thali platter, kati roll, and yogi salad. Good variety of flavors. Kasa will do the trick if you're in the area and want a quick bite.

Oh, and you can also get delivery through Caviar!
author: Joanna L.

description:
You definitely get a lot of food here for what you pay. I had the curry roasted cauliflower and saag paneer, both of which were quite good. The cauliflower was very flavorful and spicy. One of the sides was a really good cilantro paste to put on the naan (I think). 
The naan also came with a bean dip (?) which I didn't like quite as much however, and the restaurant itself was lacking in atmosphere, but maybe it just felt that way because it was so cold outside. 
I did appreciate that it was so close to the Castro Theater / Castro station / etc yet off to the side enough that it wasn't ridiculously busy on Saturday night.
author: Izzy S.

description: This is absolutely the best Thai food I've had in San Francisco. I'm vegetarian and they have loads of vegi options ! The Kati Rolls are my favorite ! You can get a snack size or a bigger one, what ever you're in the mood for! Also the Mango or Strawberry Lassi are both delicious. I have eaten there so many times since I've moved to the city. The atmosphere is also really cozy and all the staff are super friendly.
author: Deb A.

description: Authenticity at its best. Workers are fast and friendly which makes dining a pleasurable experience. Curries are spectacular as well as the salads.
author: Manjeet M.

description: The food here is so yummy and healthy! I had the yogi salad and papadum and brown rice and dal. Then I got some of their yummy chicken and had a fabulous gluten free and dairy free meal! You will love this place as they accommodate all types of eaters. Next time I'll try the lamb. :)
author: Christina H.

description:
Ordered takeout from Kasa and was surprised by how poor the food turned out to be.

- Ordered a roti and got a tortilla. Not exactly the same.
- Chicken tikka tasted like something that would work in a Kati roll but not as a separate dish.
- The dal was like a bland bean porridge.
author: S A.

description: I have had lunch here several times. I think owners might have changed, but the food is still great! I had a kati wrap today with Tika chicken and a Lassi. Delicious. A great lunch and so tasty. Pricing was more than reasonable for a lunch. I ordered the small Wrap. Next time I will get the medium. It's so good.
author: A Hart E.

description:
I wanted a healthier option, and Kasa has a salad topped with their tandoori chicken.  The chicken was delicious and moist.  The rest of the salad was okay.  I think it just had too many elements (sautéed veggies, romaine lettuce, two different sauces plus dressing, etc).  The portion was huge though, so I was full afterwards despite only eating 3/4 of it.

I'll probably come back to get a Kati roll next time I come here.
author: Vira P.

description:
I ordered the combo for lunch through post mates. I got a cup of chicken, two samosas and pakora (?) plus an Indian Coke. Everything was delicious but I'm wondering if I was supposed to get chapati? There's no vessel for the chicken...maybe it was an error but I basically ate the chicken tikka with some dipping sauce and was missing the bread! $17 for the combo which is expensive for lunch. If I had gotten the chapati, would have made it worth it. 

I've tried another Kasa location on Polk and they also were disappointing. Need to get my Indian food craving another way :/
author: Semuteh F.

description: if you're in the mood for alright indian food, come here. i would say you're better off going to a taco place around the area, though. it was a lot more expensive than i thought it was worth, but SF is expensive anyways.
author: G S.

description:
There isn't a bad dish on this menu, I know 'cause I've tried it all.

The thalis are great. The katis are great. It's all great.

Regardless of price point, everyone can find someone tasty and fresh and affordable.

Come here, eat, and enjoy!
author: William M.

description: I promised Kasa I would be back to Kasa to try the Thali combo. I got the chicken tikka masala and potatoes. It came with lentil soup(I didn't eat it), the veggies, rice, and a wrap. I liked this meal. I ate it at home and it was still warm enough. I would be back for the Thali combo.
author: Denise C.

description: There was a time when I would have given Kasa 5 stars. For the first few years after they opened the food, quality of ingredients and service was excellent. They have fallen hard -- food is average, service is deplorable, they can't roll a Kati to save their lives, it falls apart immediately turning into a soupy mush on your plate. Too bad. Talking my money and appetite to curry up now instead. They have their act together.
author: Hema P.

description: Cheap kati rolls. Probably cheapest food in the are
author: Siddhant P.

description: Great service, generous portions for reasonable prices, good flavors but could benefit from better cooked chicken, for example.
author: M L.

description: Chipotle concept for good Indian food in Castro! You can get a plate or kati roll. I love the lamb curry and chicken tika masala original rolls. You choose what to put in the roll (yogurt, salad, etc). They have a variety of drinks as well - mango lassi, beer, fountain soda with different flavors. It is fast and delicious!
author: Merve A.

description:
Kasa Eatery catered the food for our Sangeet. Anamika was such a pleasure to work with! She helped us figure out the best way to provide food for 150+ guests and was very accommodating. She was even able to get some desert that I wanted but was not on their catering menu. 

The food was really fantastic and all of our guests were raving about it. Thank you Anamika for the fantastic food and for helping to make our Sangeet a success!
author: M B.

description: First off, I'm English, I know a good curry when I eat one. This was the worst, I'm telling you, THE WORST I have ever eaten. It was cold, way too spicy, the chicken was gray... (I'm not sure if that's an Arab custom) and we both left feeling rather ill. I only really ate the naan bread which wasn't really a naan bread, it was more like a flat bread. It was in fact, the most expensive piece of bread I have ever eaten as the rest of the meal was inedible. On the plus side, the Soda's are good. That's what the one star is for. Good sodas. Just get a soda and eat somewhere else.
author: Neill S.

description:
Kinda expensive for what you get. The food was tasty, not too spicy which was great, but you clearly pay for the neighborhood. And I wasn't a fan of their chai. The best chai I've had is still a little "hole in the wall" place in San Jose. 

All in all good was fine just be prepared that it's a bit more expensive than you'd expect for what you get.
author: Dee K.

description: This is so goood. Thank you for a quick service. Went there to grab a quick bite and it was not a disappointment. Had the best roll called Kita Roll. I had the Chicken Tiki Masal and it was like heaven. The staff was nice and friendly. Thank you
author: Kourou L.

description:
Solid four stars for a great quick meal. I had a chana masala koti roll. $6 and the perfect size for a half dinner. Plus, one vegetable samosa for $2.50. The service was very friendly and the food was prepared quickly. 

The samosa was standard and tasty. Just potatoes and peas in a fried triangle of dough. The tamarind sauce was a tad too sweet on its own.

The chana masala roll was decently priced for its size. The roti it was wrapped in was expected. Hot sauce, onions, and parsley were added. The chana masala had a barbecue sauce flavor that was a little off putting at first. Maybe it was one of the added sauces to the wrap instead? However, after using my left over tamarind sauce from the samosa with it, it combined for a very good flavor.
author: ShmoHaw K.

description: BEST Indian food I've had in the city this far. It is as close as it gets to my mothers very own kitchen. Friendly staff and they actually use spice! My only piece of advice to customers who plan on getting a Kathi roll with a watery entree is to ask for it on the side and not in the roll itself. I got the Chana masala (AMAZING!) wrapped in an Original roll and my roti was pretty soggy :/
author: Raman D.

description: One of the worst Indian places. The jeera aloo can be made better by a 5year old. The chicken curry is soooo standard there is nothing good about it. The Rahman was another disaster. The mango lassi was just cardamom lassi which has a drop of mango in it. What a waste of time !!!
author: Vas L.

description:
Haven't had much Indian food but after this meal I may be a convert! Just had the lamb curry Kati roll and it was delicious although a little messy to eat. More than enough food to fill you up! The samosas were the perfect appetizer/side item crispy and delicious especially with the yogurt sauce that comes with your main dish. 

10 out 10 would recommend.
author: Neefiyah M.

description:
Was happy to find this inexpensive b&m store as I liked what I had from their truck. A couple of things : it should not cost $3.50 for a paper cup full of chai. Also, I found the saag paneer to be on the bland side. I've had many more flavorful and aromatic versions of saag elsewhere. 
My bf said the gobi aloo kati roll was pretty tasty with pickled onions, cilantro chutney, and hot sauce. 
Despite my minor issues, it's always a treat to find quick and (mostly) flavorful Indian food.
author: Kristina K.

description:
Delicious Indian food for an affordable price. I loved my thali plate. I ordered chicken tikka masala, aloo gobi (cauliflower and potatoes), and swapped swiss chard and kidney beans for the usual daal (lentils). Comes with rice, bread, and the sauces of your choice. Everything was so flavorful and well-spiced. Not too heavy either. 

Great service too! I took awhile deciding but the server was patient and helpful.
author: Nina C.

description:
I ordered on Uber eats and the order was missing rice. Called in to inform them and the person  (after confirming that I really didn't have the rice) ensured me that they wouldn't charge me for the rice. Mistakes happen, no problem. 

Everything but the rotis was good. Rotis are horrible and $2.60!!!! Frozen rotis, heated on a pan and sold as handmade rotis! Sad, I used to love this place. I called in to inquire about the rotis and person on the phone couldn't have cared less. :(
author: Mrinalini K.

description: A great find thanks to Yelp! We were in neighborhood & very hungry after a long day in sun. A quick yelp search landed us here. I used it a lot of roadside rolls back in India. This place brought back lots of old memories. We ordered Chicken tikka & kadhai paneer rolls along with far far chips. Food was great. A big thumbs up to the team working behind the scenes!
author: Vipul Z.

description: Kasa is one of those places where you stand in line, pick out what you want, pay, and find a place to sit... which ideally means good for large groups! But when we came in with a large group, the line moved reaaaally slowly and it took a long time for all of us to get served. Regardless, the food was good. I got a plate with Chicken Tikka Masala and Gobi Aloo, and everything on my plate (including what I think was lentil soup) was delicious! Really generous serving size, so I packed some of my food to go. Will be back!
author: Annie S.

description:
I guess every fast/healthy/clean food chain gonna be Chipotlized soon, this one is an example for Indian food. (Sorry, Panda Express is not a Chinese counterpart). A good choice for a decent amount of food -- try dish combo and mango lasi, both delish. 

Also, be nice to the guy behind the food counter, since he is the one decide how much amount/ good the quality of the food portion gonna end up within your dish. I guess they also count in the tips already when checking out, since it's $1-2 more than what I expected.
author: Sidong H.

description: I've eaten at Kasa for years but the pleasure in doing so is diminished by the quality of the staff and by surreal pricing. It shouldn't be necessary to repeat an order three times, especially when it is simple. What's hard to understand about "take out" or "to go"...? Recently, I've been getting a lunch of chicken on a large tortilla-like nan and a lassi. The price? $11.99. Fine. Yesterday, the employee who needed things explained three times charged $16.99 for the same meal. When I pointed this out, he began a mystifying explanation about how, if I had ordered it under a different name, it would have been $16.99 blah blah blah. I tried to email and call the owner. No response. Anyway, I'd caution against patronizing Kasa until they hire employees who don't rip off loyal customers.
author: adrian b.

description: I have my favorites here, and the 5 stars are for them.  I love the keema burrito, and several of the veggie burritos. I also like the chai here more than Samovar's.
author: Rachel R.

description:
I've had food at other Kasa eateries, but this one is insanely horrible. I ordered kati roll with a layer of egg, and the egg was half cooked. When I told the lady at the counter she was like it was my first time - really???? Then I got another Kati roll and had to pay for it - unbelievable. Even the chicken tikka was quite bad. Felt sick after having this. Never going to come back. And guys (to the owner) please have someone who knows what he/she is doing at the kitchen - not a novice - people are paying for the food. $25 down the drain. 

Best Chai in SF - not even close! Chai is probably 3/5.
author: Rohit N.

description: This is in response to the Manager of 4 years messaging me 2 days ago. I am now a former customer of at least 8 years responding. Between the two policies that were being followed, I only returned due to your rice substitution with roti option. You are not great and you are expensive so the way people return is based on convenience of location, business options and customer service. Serving roti in substitution for rice is cheaper so you make more profit on the Thali doing this and satisfy the customer. You are not our exclusive Indian, in fact ALL of your competition does this for us. Over the years I have noticed you become emptier and emptier. It is because of your horrible business practices. I will no longer return ESPECIALLY  based on your Yelp message forcing my loyalty to continue after no resolution on your part.
author: C L.

description:
I had ordered delivery from Kasa from Doordash and it estimated 56 minutes before getting the food but the text message for food getting picked up was about 20 minutes later and the driver called me about 30 min after ordering. nice! 

Ordered a medium kati roll for chicken tikka $7.50 half portion chicken tikka masala $4.50 and 2 samosas $2.95. The kati roll was kinda small but had enough meat and nice flavor. A bit of kick in the end. B/c it has been a while since it was prepared, the wrap was a bit soggy. The one I had from the food cart in NYC was better. The half portion chicken tikka masala was actually a great deal!! So much chicken! I ate it with the samosa b/c the samosa were not super flavorful and I needed a medium to eat the chicken with. It ended up being the perfect combo. Crispy samosa with soft potato was bland by itself but with the masala, it was a wonderful meal. I thought I wouldn't be full b/c the kati roll was kinda small but the 2 samosas were very filling along with the tub of chicken tikka masala. 

Yummy food!  May not order again just b/c i am visiting and there seems to be quite a few Indian options, but may give the kati rolls another chance next time i am in town and craving it; but next time, i'll eat it right there and then!
author: Camy C.

description: The staff were incredibly rude. At the end of my order, I asked for the most mild sauce available, and was given a sauce so spicy that I couldn't finish my meal.
author: Hunter H.

description:
Where do I even start ...? One day I had accidentally stumbled upon this place, while back. Since than, I've been a regular here. 

My favorite is the combination platter. I also enjoy Kati rolls too. I personally got to meet the chef, Jonathan, the customer service is phenomenal. The evening crew are amazing. Today was my first time coming in during their morning opening hours, and was helped one of the very humble owners. Thank You. Great food. Wish I could give 10 stars. Environment is very chill. Good Food is easy to find, but friendly service, isn't. This place is a gem!
author: Enzo F.

description: Cheap and tasty indian rolls...nothing too special here. We had the kadhai paneer naan roll which was tasty and filling.
author: Anant A.

description: A star each for cleanliness, good portions on the thali plate, and quick service. 2 stars off because the food just isn't that great. It's bland; the tikka sauce tasted more like marinara, the rice was over-cooked, and the cheese in the saag paneer wasn't the texture I usually look for in this dish.  I did enjoy the mango lassi's added cardamom. Overall, it works if you need something quick and filling but it's a lazy version of Indian food. I'd give it 3.5 stars but I wouldn't round to 4
author: Hayley J.

description:
Great Indian food and kind employees.
Best place in this area for plant based folks like myself! Will def be back!
author: Tulip F.

description: Lamb curry was very tender, but not over cooked, and had excellent flavor. The vegi special was also very tasty (potato and green pepper). The food had excellent flavor, and a great spicy balance. Unfortunately, I paid $16 for 2 pints of food. Next time I'll eat in and get the combo plate. Seems like a better deal. If you need something quick and delicious, but don't mind paying for it try this place. Enjoy!
author: Robert H.

description: There are many authentic Indian restaurants in this town. The food at all of these chain spots is equivalent of Panda Express for Chinese food.
author: Harland K.

description: Best Indian food in the world ! Literally recommending this place to everyone and anyone who wants great Indian food ! Everything taste good ! Especially the chicken tikka masala
author: Linda T.

description:
A group of friends came here to eat and a lot of folks never had Indian food before. I would say that this place flows like Chipotle does...fast casual food. Most of us decided to order the thali plate (platter with your choice of two main course, roti, handmade bread, slow-simmered daal, lentils, rice, veggie salad, chutneys and raita, yogurt). I went with the tikka chicken masala and the gobi aloo (cauliflower and potato). The chicken wasn't freshly cooked and was a little dry but I'm sure with more turnover the meat would've been more fresh...they just need to anticipate customer flow and not make too much and have proteins sitting out too long. 

The rest of the platter was very colorful, full of variety and pretty tasty. I don't think the spices are the most authentic, but suitable for the general American palate. For Indian food the $13 cost of the thali after taxes seemed a bit overpriced but at least I wasn't left hungry when I left. I also added on a mango lassi to help clean the palate and it was the perfect complement to the meal. It would've been nice to have some free hot chai like you'd find at most other Indian/Pakistani sit down places...but not here.

Overall, I like the simplicity of the place and the quick service. You can kind of tell that they pull from some elements of Chipotle in terms of the menu and the plating of the thali. I also liked the big communal table in the middle of the store which is good for a group of 8.
author: Sam L.

description:
Pros: reasonably priced for SF, good quantity of food, bollywood music (of course, you may not like it), fast service, cute decor including giant dabbas of masalas (spice containers).

Cons: tasteless food. Looks like the restaurant forgot that spices are to be used, not displayed as decor. I had a thali with lamb and karahi paneer for dinner. Both were nearly tasteless with the karahi paneer being worse, lacking turmeric (my Indian soul revolts at this sacrilege), other spices, even enough salt and flavor. The 'roti' was a machine made pita, no authenticity. The staff tonight were Hispanic and no offense, but if they were the cooks, they probably lacked skills in Indian cooking. Except me, all guests were white, another red fag for an ethnic restaurant.

The cashier was pleasant.
author: Yelp Fan F.

description:
This review is for Hospicio, the genuinely happy looking smily server at Kasa (Castro) these days. It's such a pleasure when you are handed a plate of good clean delicious food by a person at peace. Great job man, hope you always stay this way and people around you learn from you to actually give a shit. 

Note for the owners: we really hope you will train the staff to understand Indian meal portions. They tend to pile on the rice but are really kanjoos (skimpy) on the dal portion. The whole concept is lopsided. One needs substantial dal to "wet" the rice, and so please revise your serving proportions. We hope you will train them better!
author: Nutcrackin C.

description: Used to love this place, quick and reasonably priced. The reason I'm leaving a one star review is because of a new policy they have instated that bars customers from splitting the two ingredients that are added to the meal you are purchasing. No option for an upcharge, no explanation as to why and no interest in attempting to give their customers what they desire, and in a town with so many better options you'd think they would do what they can to keep a regular customer of 2+ years.
author: Christopher E.

description: I was so happy Kasa was opened on New Year's Day! Their food was delicious, fresh, and reasonably priced. I usually find Indian restaurant food to be too rich but again, everything here tasted really fresh and light! I ordered a thali plate which came with rice, veggies, flat bread, and two entrees. I decided to go with the classic and all time favorite chicken tikka masala, and their cauliflower entree. Everything was plated beautifully which made me even more eager as we were at the cash register paying. They had a picture of chai tea in cups that read "best chai in SF" or something along those lines. That marketing worked because I totally bought into it and hey, you don't know unless you try right? Even though it was pre-made, they didn't let me down. It was hot, tasty, and had the right balance of spices/flavor and creaminess. Plus it was super cold so a hot beverage always is a plus. Service was great, everyone was so nice! I wish I lived closer so I could visit more frequently!
author: Grace J.

description: I've visited this location at least four times, and never been disappointed.  I've had a vegetarian thali on each occasion - the options vary slightly from time to time.  It's always a generous serving of flavorful food, it's quick, and reasonably priced.  They have a good selection of both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes.  I'll definitely return next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Brendan O.

description: Good food. Staff is very nice and friendly. Lunch menu is great. I definitely like the thali plates :) my favorites are the hobo aloo and lamb curry.
author: Julian V.

description:
1st draft - 7-4-2012
2nd draft - 3-3-2014

And here now........definitely a place to go to for authentic food. Just dont go when it's close to closing time, cause the staff begins to roll out garbage, the kitchen floor mats are removed, and the stinky water runs down into the seating area. 

The rolls are to die for!
author: Me Iz S.

description:
The four stars are just for the kati roll, because I had to deal with an absurdly sassy waiter. He didn't acknowledge us when we were at the counter when the place was completely empty at 6:30PM, and when we started ordering, he somewhat rolled his eyes. When we asked questions, he would have a snappy response. What the hell?

Luckily, the food did the talking for us. I had the Kati Roll filled with Chicken Tikka Masala with the spicy sauce on the side, as well as a samosa with this delicious sauce GAH. 

The Kati roll being $5 is one thing, but it being so friggin delicious is another. Any don't worry - spicy isn't ridiculous. Just think... two bags of hot cheetoes-spicy.

I would brave the sass to eat more of this stuff any day.
author: Colleen M.

description:
3.5 stars.

Had really high hopes for Kasa, but a little bit underwhelmed.

The kati roll ($5) was delicious. It comes with a side of your choosing, cilantro-mint chutney, and other stuff (not clear what the other stuff was). I had it with chicken tikka masala. But honestly, anything wrapped in roti is bound to be pretty good.

The thali plate ($12) was a good portion size, but most of the sides tasted okay. The lentils were pretty bland. The rice was overcooked. But the roti and sides of pickled onions, pickled cabbage/veggies, tomato chutney thing, and cilantro-mint chutney were all very good. 

The lamb curry entree was good with tender lamb, but it seemed to be missing a certain spice. It tasted more like pot roast than Indian food. The karahi paneer (cheese and peppers) was pretty uneventful. It wasn't a curry like I expected, but literally just cubes of cheese and different types of peppers.

I would like to try Kasa again. Maybe different sides next time.
author: Alice T.

description: I have ordered online [www.kasaindian.com] a dozen times -- always with fast friendly service.  Kasa (near my San Francisco office) has become the go-to place for lunch or quick dinner.  Never a disappointment.  Very close to genuine Indian street food.  5 star recommendation!
author: Bill N.

description: We came in for a snack, the place had a good smell, was clean, and wry friendly people working. Ordered the 2 vegan samosas for $4, and enjoyed them thoroughly with the mint chutney they came with. Definitely worth the $4, easy, pleasant experience. If we were hungrier we would definitely try their other options.
author: Dawna B.

description: Would highly advise against ordering from here online. Not only do they jack up the prices but they also put misleading pictures with little to no description. Tried ordering samosas but was shocked to find they charge nearly $4 for a single samosa with their online menu showing 2 samosas for the price.
author: Brendan S.

description:
The second someone suggests Kati roll, I'm the first one to volunteer to go! Who doesn't love Kati rolls? 

On a recent trip to SF, when I saw the rave reviews of this place on Yelp, I didn't want to go back home until I gave it a try. 

It was pretty good but I think the best Kati roll I've ever had was at the Kati roll company in NY!
author: Vaishnovi K.

description: This is one of my favorite Indian cuisine restaurant's. The food is good and the prices aren't bad. Service was quick & friendly.
author: Maxx B.

description:
This was alright in terms of take-out. I ordered the thali plate with chicken tikka masala and aloo gobi. The chicken was good. I wasn't impressed with the aloo gobi, though. There was too little flavor.

One thing I really didn't like was the mango lassi. Mostly because it had been made and mixed 2 days prior to my order (I could see the date). It's hard to do everything all at once when orders come in, but it needs to be done by order for certain items.  Their mango lassi has cardamom seeds in it, and those seeds steeped in lassi make it taste like a cardamom lassi, and not in a good way. It was also too thick. Just disappointing because I love lassi!

Overall, I was unsatisfied and not impressed. They have an interesting selection and I would guess that some of their other dishes are done well, but really the only thing I enjoyed was the chicken, raita and papadam.
author: Julia T.

description: Was just here and ordered a chicken Tikka Masala to go.  The girl at the counter was rowing with the chefs, but made up my order to go.  I confirmed that she had given me what I ordered and of course she said yes.  I was the last customer of the day and she obviously gave me what she had left which was not chicken tikka masala.  In fact there was no sauce.  A complete con.  Save your money and go elsewhere.  RUDE and dishonest.  Shame as the neighborhood could do with a good indian.
author: Michael D.

description:
food is good but recent service is seriously lacking !

we were moving some friends into the neighborhood 1 block away and ordered online for pickup. when we went to go pick up, our order wasn't there or ready. after some time figurign out what happened it turns out we had accidentally placed our order for the polk location. ack ! $80 of food is all the way across town during rush hours:(
they just shrugged their shoulders and didn't say anything.
we were to stunned to do anything, or ask. i know responsibility ultimately rested upon us but
ideally, they would have offered to make us food at that location, or apologise. or something.

we ended trucking across town anyways. but did not feel at all good about it.
author: Men L.

description:
All I should need to say to explain my 3 star review is: they don't have naan!
C'mon. Indian food without naan? 
If that were it, maybe I would be more generous. But there food wasn't that good either and they didn't have a big variety. #disappointed
author: Julianna I.

description:
Probably the best Indian restaurant I have eaten at in SF! Delicious food, just as good as my mothers(maybe even better due to the quality of ingredients). Coming from a home that cooked Punjabi food every day, this spot is worth your money:).  
My order : Saag Paneer Kati with a side. The other day my side was Gajeer Zucchini but last night was Aloo Gobi..  

Oh yeah, don't forget the Chai.. SO delicious
author: Raman D.

description:
First- food is great. I am not a scholar on Indian food at all but we all loved it. Even our kids ate it. Nice place, cool area, good food!  

Now for the bad. First of all, this is more of a $$ than $. So don't expect good prices. Seems they raised the prices from some of the reviews I saw. But that alone isn't a big deal. 

Biggest issue was the lady behind the counter.  She seemed to be the supervisor or manager that was working the counter and register most. She was hurried and rude and it wasn't even busy! Since we don't eat Indian much I wanted help deciding what to order. I could hardly hear her or understand. She made other customers wait that had questions instead of just a quick yes or no answer. 

If you can tolerate poor service give this place a shot. Good food.
author: Daniel M.

description: OMG YUM! I'm not sure if other Yelpers are being super critical,nOr if their notion of good food is different than mine - but I think Kasa is absolutely delicious, yummy, home made Indian food severed by sweet staff in the heart do the Castro. To boot it's pretty healthy & basically affordable for what you get. I've been eating there since they opened but today was so struck by the giant Thali plate I got - packed with brown rice, Chapati, veggies, raita, herbs, onions, and daal - plus lamb curry & shulamun (yummy turnips). I'm not of Indian descent - but I've been eating good Indian food both my whole life - here in the US & during a trip to India - and can say that this is really an awesome spot. It's true it's not the spiciest - but it's an American misconception that all Indian food is spicy - not true! Give it a try if you like fresh yummy flavorful sweet in a great purple house :-)
author: P J.

description: That food it's fresh and awesome ,in addition their costumer service was great . Combination of delicious food and outstanding service = so what are you waiting for ???  Go there ...
author: Amir H A.

description: We ate here twice during our vacation and it was amaaaazzziiinnnggg. The staff is super friendly and helpful, the food tastes amazing and fresh. Wish they had it where I live!
author: Katie J.

description:
Was on our way to Squat & Gobble with the roomie until we spotted this place. We walked by it earlier and commented on how good it smelled!

I've seen their trucks around and had no idea there was a brick and mortar location. I was super confused about their special menu and tried to order the eggplant and the guy was all confused. He pointed out what the actual two specials were and neither sounded appealing but I got the spinach one. Only $5 for a roll and it was enough food to fill me up! Definitely get two if you're hungry though. 

I looked up this place on Yelp while waiting and had no idea it was so popular! Guess we made the right choice. Definitely a no frills place and our meal did not make for a pretty instagram photo though I posted it anyways. Just a yummy lil roll on a giant silver plate. You pay at the register and serve yourself utensils and water. Yum yum.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
I will give it 3 1/2
The food was good thou. You would expect a lot of flavor, but it is not that much, does it make sense? 
The price was really good. 
The music was goood.
If I am hungry and don't want to spend that much, I will go back :)
author: Andres D.

description: The best place ever! Great vegan options! Everyone must try the wraps!!! Amazing!!!!! Huge samosas too, don't go anywhere else before you stop here!!!
author: Chris D.

description:
I live very close to Kasa and eat there regularly; positive comments on the food (yes, sometimes a bit too spicy) But what bothers me is the turnover of employees: I might exaggerate slightly, but it looks like there are new people every month. 
Message to the manager: the way you treat your employees, reflects on the service they give to the customer...there are always going to be enough young people needing the pay and willing to accept your work conditions but asa they get a slightly better opportunity, they'll go and you can start over again training people... Maybe you don't care (might be even good for your tax deductions) but it shows what is going on behind the scenes in your business. Take an example in Bi-rite supermarket down the street; same employees for years, all have a sense of ownership and their service is the best.

Update: Kasa's manager replied and I drew wrong conclusions about the personnel turnover...very happy to be wrong, will continue to go there!
author: An V.

description:
Once my go-to place,  so sad it has now became one of the ill flavored horrible serviced restaurants in the neighborhood :(
Funny taste turkey, hard to chew on burnt chicken tika,  Dal that has mostly water in it,  and a salad that you can actually taste the perservative-bottled lemon juice of it. 
Not to mention they sometimes 'forget' to add the rotting bread to the thaly plate, kid's highchairs are stored in the restrooms (eeew..) and the music,  that use to be a fun background Playlist, and now is an eclectic medley,  playing so loud you can't really have a nice conversation over lunch. 
This one has not been my first bad experience here,  but I thought a place that use to be that good should get a slave for a couple of fails.  Well -  we're past that point now :(
author: Dana S.

description: The owner reached out to me and comped me for the inconvenience. I have been back a few times now and the quality seems much improved. Props for caring.
author: N M.

description:
Context: The most recent time I've been here was a Sunday lunch and from the food truck at Treasure Island Flea Market.

Location: Walking distance to Dolores Park and Bi-Rite. Delicious combination

Sidenote: THIS IS THE INDIAN VERSION OF CHIPOTLE. ITS DELICIOUS. Ordering a kati roll is like ordering a Chipotle burrito, ordering a thali platter is like ordering a burrito bowl. 

Service: Like I said, its a Indian Chipotle. So, there's a queue, you order and watch them make it, and then pay at the register. You pick it up and sit at a table and you bus it yourself. Its great.  Grab all the utensils and napkins you want, as well as pour yourself some water at the service station next to the register. There is even a fennel palate cleanser/breath freshener, too! Just remember to clean up after yourself. Anyway, the people at the counter are efficient and friendly. They answered my questions about certain plates happily. Also, its super easy to order to-go and just walk to the park if you don't want to eat inside!

Ambiance: Its clean, casual, high ceiling, cute framed pictures, and big windows. You can easily move tables together if you have a big group. It puts off a really relaxed aura, while some places that are packed and bustling make me anxious, Kasa is calm. 

FOOD:
Kati Roll - Chicken Tikka Marsala. Its delicious. It looks small but its fantastic. Order one for $4-5 if you're not extremely hungry. Order two, three (or four) if your tummy is roaring and grumbling! You can put whatever dish you like in the Kati Roll, I've only personally tried the Kati Roll with Chicken Tikka Marsala, but order three different Kati rolls if you want to try different dishes OR you can order...

Thali Platter - Lamb Curry (if you order adds an extra $1, but its worth it!) + Chicken Tikka Marsala. This is a big plate for $10-11. It has all the sides with salad, lentils and rice. Its freakin' awesome and its HUGE. This is great if you like a variety of different flavors and textures in your meal. Its big and I definitely have to share it with someone. But, I'm a tiny Asian girl so that was to be expected. But, if you have a big big appetite, get the Thali Platter. It also comes with steaming hot roti!

I have to admit I like this place, but its fast food ambiance put me off just a little bit. This area has so many other great restaurants, too. Kasa has some rough competition with the other sit-in restaurants. But, when you can't wait and want a quick and relaxed bite, Kasa's where I would go.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Such a sad example of what was a great new restaurant failing to continue with its origin and fall to its success.
Kasa was always my go to place when in the Castro. The food was fresh, the meat was tender and juicy and the mouth watering flavors where OUT of this world. Now the meat is chewy, flavorless unrecognizable boneless chicken that is served with bones. Roti rolls taste flat and stale. The once mouthwatering flavors are a thing of the past, now just bland and motionless. This was now my 3rd and final attempt at what once was.

Bring back your origins and roots or the Castro crowd will surely move on as others have.
author: Sean S.

description:
We had Chicken Tikka Marsala Kati, a Combo Plate with Saag Paneer, and Curry Lamb, a Samosa, and a Mango Lassi.

The Chicken Tikka Marsala Kati roll was alright, it's $5 and pretty small. 

You get to choose two dishes with the combo plate so we got Saag Paneer which was the daily special and Curry Lamb. The Saag Paneer was okay... and the Curry Lamb was pretty disappointing. It really didn't have much curry in it? Was more like a braised lamb.

You could get a chicken Samosa or a Veggie one, we went with the chicken. The Samosa was actually pretty good but a bit expensive (I think it was like $2.50 for one or $5 for 2?)

The Mango Lassi was spiced... as in it's not sweet and tasted very herbal (I believe it's cardamom?). I wish they wrote that in the description because it's not really what I expect when I order a mango lassi.

Overall, this place is just a mediocre fast food indian place...
author: Lily L.

description:
What can I say about Kasa that hasn't already been said.... nothing much =)
The food is exceptionally delicious.  I told the staff the other day shortly after inhaling the masterpiece the put in front of my face that they undoubtedly made a pretty good day turn into an AWESOME day.  Speaking about the staff, couldn't get any friendlier and actually listen to the customers making sure they get exactly what they want.  They also have a special talent of making each person feel as if they were a member of the family.  A distant relative which they haven't seen in months.  I guess what I'm trying to say is I recommend Kasa.  I would recommend this place time and time again like I do to all my friends, family, and patients.  I tend to talk about food a lot I guess...
author: Christian H.

description:
My girlfriend and I went to the Castro yesterday to commemorate the momentous lifting of the ban on same-sex marriage in California. It was quite a sight. Castro went absolutely nuts. Hooray equality!

Anyway, Kasa Indian Eatery was kind of in the thick of all of it so we decided to check it out. 

Not bad. Not bad at all. 

When we got there, there were still a lot of empty tables and a manageable queue but by the time we got our food, the line got pretty crazy and extended all the way to the sidewalk and all the tables had been taken. Good thing there were still some empty stools on the counter by the door. 

We turned to Yelp (as we often do) to help us decide what to order. The Kati Roll was the consensus so we went with that. And besides, we are fans of anything wrapped in a warm blanket of dough. It makes the food feel safe and loved. 

We tried the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Lamb Kati Roll and got a few Samosas too. I wasn't too impressed with the Tikka Masala although I think it might have been because we didn't specify to add heat. It lacked that oomph. 

The Lamb was pretty tasty and very tender and I like how it was mixed with some mint chutney and red onions. Yogurt sauce was also scooped onto the plate and it was a perfect compliment to the strong flavors of the curries.

The samosas were pretty delicious too. Especially slathered in some of that refreshing yogurt sauce.

All in all, I was fairly delighted with my experience at Kasa and will definitely be back (to try the papadums and the combination plates). The staff is attentive and friendly, the food is cheap and tasty and you can order beer or wine to go along with your meal. 

I also appreciate the whole "serve and bus your own tray" model. It eliminates the need for paying extra for a service that frankly, we can really do without in most cases.

4.1 stars.
author: Angelo B.

description:
Update... This place has become pretty disgusting over the years.
They do not make fresh Rotis on site anymore, infact they get frozen ones shipped from Canada??? Really.. So much for the reputation of freshness in the Bay Area :-(
The quality of their food has worsened tremendously and it's sad:-(
author: Justyna R.

description: The food is OK and the idea is a good one. But the restaurant has been absurdly dirty the last two times we have eaten here. Also, not coincidentally, it was swarming with flies. The last time we were there was a Friday evening, just before the dinner rush, around 5:15.
author: Morris R.

description: I got 2 roti rolls and they were yummy. Very messy but yummy. Very flavorful and delicious. I had the chicken tikka masala and the lamb. I enjoyed the chicken more. I would definitely go here again but have tons of napkins with me.
author: Heather S.

description:
You know how Panda express isnt real chinese food, well Kasa indian isnt real indian food...

Honestly, indian food is pretty cheap and I'm sure there are WAY better places around the area.
author: David K.

description: Rude people and mediocre food and if you order in dont expect them to deliver everything, check and make sure they didnt forget things.
author: Avani R.

description:
I am still loving Kasa! Even though they have expanded and added a food truck, the quality is still excellent. There are a few new things on the menu that I really like, including the chicken meatballs and the chicken samosas. Those chicken samosas are so delicious! I love their chai still too, although super sweet, it is definitely a treat. 

Their channa masala is excellent too. I just wish they would bring back the okra curry!
author: Katherine B.

description: Great chicken tikka masala.  Right amount of spice.. Although I'm Indian.. Some of you a tad paler might disagree.  :-)  Service was fast too
author: Mahesh N.

description:
I have been eating here for more than 6 years, and it is my favorite Indian.  I love each and every dish (except meat, since I am veg), and I especially love their chai.  Sometimes I go to town and order two, but then the caffeine makes me pretty wacky.  I hate beans, but I actually crave the daal--it is so creamy and satisfying!  

I have scanned some of the reviews, and OMG some people are bonafide a-holes!  Giving the place a crummy review because you went one time (after enjoying many experiences there), and you got a little less food than the previous visits?  Get real--this isn't McDonalds, it's real food!   Would the same people freak out if they ordered at another Indian restaurant and got 10 pieces of paneer in their curry and only 7 another time?  Freaking crazy people.  They also don't weigh the food by the pound when they serve it. 

Best part is the employees.  I have eaten at the truck countless times as well as both physical locations, and the employees are very kind and accommodating.  For instance, just politely ask for a little more filling, and they will likely accommodate; or at least try that first before giving a crummy review.  I probably have eaten there 300 times, and I have never noticed a change in the quality of the food.  

Now on the other hand, Samovar used to serve rice pudding with their Indian tea service.  Then they took away the entire dessert and raised the price $5.  Now THAT's something to bitch about!
author: Kandi K.

description: I'm not sure if I'm understanding why this place is so popular. The portions are miniature and it's not *that*good. Went here three times, trying something new each time. Am I missing something? Am I completely crazy? I feel like I should say something blasphemous like I wish this place was naan n curry instead. Maybe I'm really just supposed to have a beer and people watch from the window and then hop skip over to Dolores Park. Then I might know what I'm missing.
author: Natasha P.

description:
The service is friendly and quick as the food at Kasa is served cafeteria style. However, it's hit or miss what's available at the moment. I struck out on the samosas and the lamb curry but there was a decent variety left.

Out of what I did order there were some disappointments:
- Aloo jera was very salty.
- Chicken Tiki Marsala tasted a bit bland.
- Bread was hard.

I'm more of a meat person but the Daily Vegetable was the highlight of the plate.
author: Calvin H.

description:
This place looked really good and has good reviews, which is what drew me in in the first place. 

THE GOOD THINGS: It has good atmosphere, good music, etc. The yogurt and other sides, such as the salad, were good and really flavorful. The chai was also amazing, especially iced. You get a relatively good amount of food for the price. 

THE BAD: The meal itself was a disappointment. Everything was lukewarm and tasted similar. I got the combo platter, and I had the Kalia Aloo daily special, as well as Saag Paneer. The Aloo tasted like chemicals and the paneer had only one piece of cheese in it and hardly had a flavor. Plus, there was hardly any rice, and I ran out long before I could eat the rest. 

The people who helped us treated us like we were stupid, and I don't know why. Maybe we are stupid, and this place is great, but I did not have a good experience.
author: Hannah H.

description:
Not even deserving of 1 star.  

Here's my story....Friday night I order through Try Caviar and decide to give Kasa a shot because I've heard pretty good things about them and they receive an average of 4 stars on Yelp.  

Fast forward an hour or so later and the delivery guy shows up, I sit down to eat my food and instantly spit it out because it was way too SALTY, disgustingly SALTY, basically inedible. I ordered the chicken tikka masala thali plate.  If I was in the restaurant I would've returned it but because I ordered through Try Caviar they have to settle with the restaurant if I want a refund.  But this is not a review for Try Caviar it's a review for Kasa, which I recommend staying away from unless you want to be disappointed and sick to your stomach.

If I knew I was going to receive awful food I would've ordered pizza instead.
author: Jaclyn L.

description: The food is OK, nothing special or memorable. Got the Thali Platter. It's a nice combo but unfortunately the naan was really rubbery and the papadam was soggy and tough.
author: Stephanie A.

description: So gross!! I ate the food from the lead tray! I have smelled like i ate chemical thing all the time. I almost threw up!! Omg i wont go back again
author: Thiti C.

description: I was in the area, needed something to eat, and happened to be craving Indian. The menu is a little confusing if you haven't been to Kasa before. There are lots of different specials and combinations. Of course, you can always ask the people behind the counter, but personally I would just go for a Kati Roll ($5.50) or two. Order Chicken Tikka Masala... it has the perfect level of spice. One roll was enough for me, but get some sort of combination meal if you are hungry. Helpful and friendly service. I would not go out of my way to come back, but I'll definitely be happy when I do!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Passed by over the years many times but never tried. Really good lunch spot. Go up to the counter and order then choose a seat in or out. Great lentil soup and chai tea. Salad with chicken, kidney beans, and veges delicious. Good sauces.
author: Joe M.

description:
If you are reading this review while searching for a good eatery near Castro, DO NOT come here! DO NOT!

While meandering in Castro, we were searching for a good place to eat and Kasa looked interesting. As we walked towards the restaurant, the receptive ambiance made us order kati rolls, thalis (plates), samosas and mango lassi. This was seriously one of the WORST Indian food that I have eaten by far. I mean, how can one possibly go wrong with mango lassi? Just put mangoes, yoghurt and sugar in the blender. They could not even get that right.

Being born and raised in India, the only reason I keep myself away from Indian restaurants in the US is because of the food that these restaurants claim to be authentic, i.e, basically restaurants like Kasa. Although lately I have been daring myself to explore a few Indian restaurants, going to such yucky restaurants like Kasa are seriously driving me away from ever going to another Indian restaurant anytime in the near future.

Not just me, but my non-Indian friends despised the food as well. Though they were hungry, they could not even finish the meal.
author: Anu M.

description: Looks cute from outside but food is very low quality. Spare yourself.... Apparently at one time it was good.
author: emmanuelle a.

description:
One of my favorite spot for quick tasty Indian food.   Thali plate with 2 main dishes, rice, lentil purée, salad, yogurt that come with the set are all great.  

Chicken Tikka Masala, Purée Spinach w/cheese, Gobi (Cauliflower and Potato)

Highly recommended!
author: Wan T.

description:
Skip the food truck and head straight to their restaurant! The fresh ingredients will blow your taste buds away.  

Clean and visible kitchen
Diverse flavors
House made roti
Vegetarian options
Friendly service
author: Marcus S.

description: This is the worst Indian food I've had to date in San Francisco. I had it delivered by Caviar, and the delivery part of the equation was not the issue. It was the taste and quality of every item that came in my variety dinner plate, highlighted by bland chicken tikka masala.
author: Captain B.

description: Great concept and delicious Indian cuisine! The combo platter is big enough to split, we made the mistake of getting our own, it was a lot of food! Great beer selection to top it off!!
author: Chris S.

description:
Not what it used to be. This place used to have the best Tikka Masala ever! Seriously, I would never get sick of it.

Then recently, they raised the price and changed the recipe. Now it is only average and not something I can look forward to. The chicken is no longer grilled first which leaves the thigh meat gummy and gross.  On top of that, they changed the Tikka sauce recipe removing the yogurt or cream and now it's just like a tomato sauce.

What a shame.  This place could have been great for years to come. If they keep going this direction... It's only down hill from here.
author: b d.

description: Dined in and the food was cold, bland, overpriced. Don't see the point of eating here again as there is other Indian in the area.
author: Jessica M.

description: All the items were served luke warm. Sub par quality paneer was used to prepare saag paneer. Meat and veggie dishes were next to each other and they got all mixed up.
author: Krishna P.

description:
I've definitely had better for much cheaper (e.g. Urbann Turbann in Berkeley & the Curry Up Now food truck), and in my opinion, their prices are a bit too steep for their portions. $5 for an Indian wrap small enough to fit in the palm of my hand? No thank you.

Honestly, their fare seems more suited as street food served out of a food truck than a dine-in restaurant. Fortunately for them, they already have that all figured out.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Superb tikka and lamb curry! Delivery was ultra efficient and scheduled, which made so much difference. The execution for the to-go  orders, I truly commend and appreciate. The food is compartmentalized, neat and very much helpful as far as recognizing various Indian flavors for gourmands especially the gourmets who have discerning palette. 

Oh and yeah, very reasonable too! :)
author: Paulina L.

description:
I ordered kati rolls for my graduation party and the rolls were GONE within a few minutes of my guests arriving. We got the Gobi Aloo and Aloo Jeera (perfect for vegan friends!) and both were SO delicious.

The kati rolls are like small Indian burritos. I ended up cutting them in half to make them snack-size for a party. Could be eaten in the foil or with a cocktail napkin (unless you're using the yogurt, then you need a plate or surface for dipping).

I ordered ahead and the kati rolls were ready to go at the scheduled pick-up time.

Highly recommend for social gathering and catering. Great to stop in for pick-up or eating there too!!
author: Chanda G.

description: Food tasted fine but painfully small portions, especially for the price. I think I am hungrier now than I was before I ate this food. :(
author: Jennifer G.

description: My friend recommended this place as being a lot of food for not a lot of money (great lunchtime value). She was right AND it is all so fresh and good. I stood gawking at the menu not knowing where to start and the server helped me pick a winning combination of a plate that I will now come back for!
author: Lozzy W.

description: The kati rolls are damn good. Husband ordered a karahi paneer kati roll and I got a chicken tikka kati roll, really liked the paratha wrap. The chai came with parle-g biscuits!
author: Subhadra D.

description:
I never ate Indian food before coming here, but since my boyfriend couldn't make reservations at this one restaurant, we decided to drive around SF & we ended up in Castro. Couldn't really find a good restaurant that sounded appealing, so we yelped up places nearby & good thing we found this place! 

Kasa is blended into a residential area, but it's purple-ish & right at a corner so you wouldn't miss it! The interior is really cute, the tables are set up with a flower in a middle. Cute for a date! 

I wasn't quite familiar with Indian food and I really didn't know what to order, so I let my boyfriend handle that. We ordered a platter of chicken tikka masala & karahi paneer with a samosa & housemade chai. It was so good!! Very content. I would definitely come back here if I'm in the area. And if you're craving for coffee, Philz is just a few doors down :)
author: Alyssa F.

description: A very solid 3--no complaints. A great place for some fast casual Indian food. Tasted good, nothing to write home about, but satisfied the itch. Apparently local ingredients, so a plus there. The thali was way more food than I needed, but I love to sample.
author: Fran B.

description: Would probably give it a 3.5 stars. I always go there for their kathi rolls, quick indian comfort food. They are not the best but not bad either. Have had their aalo jeera, paneer karahi , chicken tikka masala rolls. All of them are good.
author: Varun A.

description:
I have always enjoyed eating here. That was the case until Sunday when a friend and I ate there and BOTH of us got food poisoning. He and I spent last night violently vomiting and today both of us had to call in sick.

Considering that about 20% of the other reviews mention food poisoning I suspect they are using some very poor food handling techniques. I will be reporting them to the health department tomorrow. They could kill somebody!

Update: so the health department went by after receiving our complaints, and found that they were in fact mishandling and undercooking their chicken.  The SFDPH inspector gave them instructions, and hopefully the person/management on duty implemented those changes.  I would consider returning to them now, because like I said, I really liked this place before the food poisoning incident.
author: Robert S.

description:
Came here every sunday after yoga to refuel with my friends. Love the food here, hopefully Kasa will continue to expand and move over to AZ, where I currently reside.

As someone who has been to India several times, it is a taste that can rarely be imitated and Kasa does an amazing job. The chai is the truest I have found to an authentic Indian street taste. Excellent!
author: Joe N.

description: Got a plate with chicken tikka and chicken tikka masala. Was a great post gym quick eat for $11 (pre tax). And they played Dr Dre, so that did make me happy too
author: David H.

description: Food taste ok, location convenient, so go there often, but their service is constantly bad.
author: Hayden J.

description: The food is good. But they either have one song that is an hour long, or it plays on endless repeat, or they have several songs with the exact same beat. The music is so terrible it gives me a splitting headache
author: Alex L.

description:
1.good food and tasty. 
2.Karahi panneern .sag panneer roti are real good.

Cons:
1.small portions. Can increase the portion size for the amount charged.
author: Vamsi E.

description:
The food and service here are fine; even the outdoor tables are nice.  But when business management chooses to block bus access in order to make loading the food carts easier, they are Mission-Dolores Park Disability Obstruction.  Management just doesn't care.

Be part of the inclusive neighborhood Kasa - move your food trucks out of the bus stop!
author: SF Disability Awareness N.

description:
So, if you're looking for naan, you should try somewhere else, because this INDIAN restaurant doesnt have any. Are you joking me? What am I supposed to dip into my Tikka masala? Your sad excuse of a substitute? 

No thanks, never again... 

2 stars for lack of food poisoning.
author: Ben Z.

description:
First time eating at Kasa and I am a fan!  You order at the counter and watch the server scoop up your food into a metal platter that made me think of prison lunch lines for some reason.  Then you order your drinks from a second worker and pay for your meal.  After that, you find a seat by the tall counters or one of the few tables in the restaurant.  Most of the tables were taken when we ordered, but one did clear up by the time me and my partner-in-crime(PIC) paid and started looking for seats.

We ordered 2 thali plates ($10.95), which came with roti (handmade bread), lentils, rice,yogurt, veggie salad, and chutney.  I ordered the chicken tikka masala and the gobo aloo (cauliflower and potato...easily my fav dish).  My PIC ordered the chicken tikka and the karahi paneer (their cheese is AMAZING).  In addition, we each ordered a drink.  I got the hot chai ($2.50) and my PIC ordered the mango lassi ($3).

Both of us were really satisfied with our meals and will definitely keep Kasa in mind when looking for homestyle Indian food.  I could totally see myself becoming a vegetarian if I knew how to  make food as delicious, hearty, and healthy as what I had at Kasa.
author: May W.

description: Yummy, had a super Kati roll with the chicken masala loaded. It was great! I couldn't eat it all and it was very filling.
author: Daniel Y.

description: I had lunch here today. Phenomenal food, affordable and quick. Family driven atmosphere, you can tell they take care of their staff.
author: Joseph B.

description:
Perhaps not the worst Indian food I have ever eaten, but close.

The food is terribly bland and somewhat overpriced considering the lack of attention that went in (or didn't?) into the preparation. Tasteless grey lamb paired with completely watered down daal and raita topped off the the worst naan imaginable. It was dense and saturated with oil somehow. Maybe it was all wonderful stuff hours and hours ago when it was initially prepared.

Avoid this place. Anyone giving it four or five stars must have a palate based on Trader Joe's.
author: Easwud C.

description:
Their speciality is reputedly the Kolkatta "Kati Rolls". 

They do a pretty decent job at it but failed to advertise the "real Kati roll" in their menu. Instead they merely lay out the options and fillings like a burrito place. Hence the star of the show has been relegated to a sideshow and completely lost on the casual customer (which is almost all of them). 

For those who came in late, a Kolkatta Chicken Katti Roll is made thusly (to borrow a word from Alton Brown): Paratha, an egg beaten and cooked on/with the paratha on the tava, chicken tikka, generous portions of juliennes of red-onions and cilantro, a dash of finely chopped green chillies, lime juice and a dash of the "Chinese" green chillies ketchup, a pinch of pepper all served up as a wrap. "Roll" is Indian for "wrap" -- and not a dinner/bread roll. 

Coming to the aforementioned Kati Rolls, the parathas are a little too thin and does not have the thick, hardy, crispy-on-the-outside Kati rolls as found on the streets of Kolkatta (formerly Calcutta, the erstwhile capital of British India). The onions were sadly limp, and lacked the crunch (they were probably chopped a few hours in advance) that is expected and treasured. The green ketchup is missing but I don't blame them as I don't see this particular condiment in stores. 

All in all, the kati roll is the closest thing to the real deal in these united states and goes a long way in relieving my cravings. And what's more ? They also sell India's best selling cola - "Thumbs Up". 

I couldn't care less for any of the plated meals. 
Let's Kati Roll baby ! :-)
author: Umesh T.

description:
Indian Burritos = Genius. This is one of those places I miss soooo much back in SF! I still have cravings for this place and pay it a visit every time I'm back. 

I always get one lamb curry kati roll and a chicken tika masala kati roll. And I pay a little extra and get them Unda style - where they cook an egg into the naan wrap that adds a nice extra flavor + some extra protein for ya. 

You end up leaving totally stuffed, despite the burritos deceptively small size. I can't recommend this place enough, try it for yourself and you'll have trouble going back to regular non-indian burritos.
author: Chris T.

description:
Outstanding delicious Indian food. They have great combo deals & the cashier behind the counter was kind enough to thoroughly go over it because I hadn't dined like that before. 
Everything was delicious, and I left completely stuffed. Their mango lassi was so refreshing. Tucked away on a quiet street of Castro, this is a cute place to go with friends or family for a quick bite to eat.
author: Ariana V.

description:
Three stars sums up my visit exactly: A-Ok.

Not great, not bad, very middle of the road. The restaurant itself was busy and the menu is minimal and the service quick. The prices are decent, especially for the Kati roll, which is in my opinion very much like a soft taco or burrito (but not as big).

I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala Kati. It's not big enough to merit a full meal, but definitely the size of a generous snack. It's not too heavy but still satiates that need for a little bit of flavor and protein. 

I really love Indian food, but this is more like quick serve food (though not nearly as bad as somewhere like Naan N' Curry) and it's not as good as a real sit down Indian restaurant.
